data.title: Death in Paradise Christmas special: Who plays DI Neville Parker's mum?
data.meta_description: Death in Paradise is welcoming a very special guest for its 2023 Christmas special so who is the actress behind Neville Parker's mum?
data.text:
Ralf Little shares an update on Death in Paradise

WARNING: This article contains spoilers from the Death in Paradise Christmas Special.

Death in Paradise is returning for its second ever Christmas special and fans are already curious to know more about the star behind DI Neville Parker’s mum Melanie.

Neville Parker (played by Ralf Little) had a difficult time in season 12 as his beloved girlfriend Sophie (Chelsea Edge) turned out to be a killer, wanting revenge as she blamed him for the death of her sister years prior.

This twist made Neville think it was time he left Saint Marie for good but following a particularly tricky case, he thankfully chose to stay in Guadeloupe with his friends.

Another investigation will be underway in the Christmas special which airs at 9pm on Boxing Day on BBC One with the death of an entrepreneur and the disappearance of the family’s marketing guru.

What Neville wasn’t counting on, however, was his bubbly mum Melanie (Doon Mackichan) showing up for the holidays.

Read more: Death in Paradise star teases trouble ahead as new arrival 'stirs everything up'

Follow Daily Express US on Facebook and Twitter @ExpressUSNews

Who plays Neville Parker’s mum in the Death in Paradise Christmas Special?

Neville’s mum, Melanie, in Death in Paradise is portrayed by actress, comedian and writer Doon Mackichan.

She was famously behind the double-Emmy-Award winning series Smack the Pony, starring with other comedic performers including Fiona Allen, Darren Boyd and Sally Phillips.

Mackichan regularly appeared in the sitcom Plebs for five years as a character called Flavia but is probably better known now for playing Cathy in the Scottish BBC series Two Doors Down.

She has also made appearances in The Duchess, Funny Woman, Good Omens, Death on the Tyne and Flack.

Melanie is very much the opposite of Neville and has been described by actor Little as “gregarious, fun, loving and seizes the moment and the day”.

He explained: “She just lives life to enjoy herself and she's the first person that gives Neville a bit of a pep talk and says, ‘Look, don't give up on something just because it's hard.’

“It’s not that he just snaps out of it and that solves everything, but it's the first time we see him told and that’s sort of the start of his road to emotional recovery.”

Following the Christmas special, Death in Paradise is once again expected to return for season 13 sometime in early 2024.

Spin-off Beyond Paradise, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton, is believed to be making a comeback in spring 2024 for season two.

There has also been news that another spin-off is on the way in the shape of Return to Paradise which could come out later this year.

Following the familiar format of the first two shows, Return to Paradise will see a Met Police officer forced to return to her home country of Australia where she starts getting to work on some head scratching investigations.

The Death in Paradise Christmas Special airs on Boxing Day at 9pm on BBC One.
